website_summaries.verdict: The best budget computer processor designed to improve everyday computing tasks.
pros: CPU chip design enhances web responsiveness, word processing, and other daily tasks
Lower cooling requirements makes it more affordable when purchasing a new motherboard and heat sink
cons: Only comes as a dual-core setup

website_summaries.verdict: A lightning-fast Intel processor that's simple to use and delivers exceptional results.
pros: Provides a graphics base frequency of 350 MHz
More affordable than many comparable processors
Superb choice for those who require outstanding clock speed
cons: Can be tough to use in conjunction with Windows devices

customer_reviews.title: Good processor for windows 10 only !
customer_reviews.text: Great processor...but microsoft will make it very difficult if you want to use it on a win7 machine...they are doing everything in their power to force people to use windows 10 !
customer_reviews.author: william pettit

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU, Good Performance - Would Recommend for Anyone on a Budget
customer_reviews.text: This is a powerful little CPU that packs a lot of power and performance into a product that isn't very expensive. It's definitely a reasonable deal for its current price and it is worth every penny! I have been using this CPU in my personal desktop computer for six months, and it has been working great and stepping up to all the challenges that my not-too-overwhelming workload has been able to throw at it. I'd highly recommend it for anyone on a budget; there certainly are more powerful CPUs that can do a lot more, but at this price you can't beat this one! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Layman

customer_reviews.title: Great Entry Level Processor!
customer_reviews.text: This little processor is a great start for anyone looking to game. I run Flight Simulator X, American Truck Sim, Sim City 4, The Sims 3, and GTA V along with streaming to youtube with OBS. I am using a gt 1030 grapics card along with 8gb ddr4 ram. This little thing excesed expectations.
customer_reviews.author: christian

customer_reviews.title: Reliable CPU for Miner
customer_reviews.text: During the mining craze, I also hoped on board. To get the job done, I purchased this CPU for my rig. I've had zero issues with it and give it an over high rating based on its capacity to run Windows or Linux smoothly, installed easily, and came with the required hardware (fan included). Very pleased - NOT for gaming PC's :)
customer_reviews.author: Marius Morosanu

customer_reviews.title: great for gamers on a tight budget
customer_reviews.text: Great for gaming and productivity (if you use it alongside a gpu, that is.)
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: ... an alright product but there is quite a few better options for a budget cpu
customer_reviews.text: It's an alright product but there is quite a few better options for a budget cpu. It can feel very slow at times.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Good value i3 cpu.
customer_reviews.text: Great cpu for the price. Only reason I bought it was because the mobo I purchased only took 7th gen cpus and for some reason the ram wont run max speeds with anything 6th gen.
customer_reviews.author: GOHMZ

customer_reviews.title: Nice high ghz cpu.
customer_reviews.text: The problem with this isn’t a problem with cpu itself it’s fine, the problem is for 80$ you can get a pentium gold that’s more powerful. If I had known that at the time I would have got the pentium but this is powerful enough for my gaming rig.
customer_reviews.author: N. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Budget CPU
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from an intel pentium g4400 and i can hardly notice the difference between the two, if you are getting this for gaming i would advice getting a quad-core CPU
customer_reviews.author: Junior

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I play PUBG and Overwatch and this processor has given me no problems
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: Nice price and snappy processor
customer_reviews.text: Works solidly in my rig. Nice price and snappy processor.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: 7th gen is harder to find these days, great CPU but
customer_reviews.text: if you can build 8th or 9th gen, go that route instead. Also consider the i3-9100f CPU
customer_reviews.author: BiteMyTaco

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU for Everyday Use
customer_reviews.text: Best Intel Core i3 ever made, as fast as my old Intel i5-2500.
customer_reviews.author: E. E. Coad

customer_reviews.title: Genuine
customer_reviews.text: Genuine Intel. Use this in my media server that runs 24/7. Never had an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kingbuttmonkey

customer_reviews.title: Good Processor
customer_reviews.text: Be careful not to bend the pins on you CPU socket when you install the processor...
customer_reviews.author: David W

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fast and solid product. Pared with the MSI B250M Bazooka motherboard. Five stars!
customer_reviews.author: tickyour

customer_reviews.title: Did not boot up
customer_reviews.text: Problems right out of the box. Will not boot up. Tried with a known good motherboard and confirmed no boot up. I will have to get another processer a different type.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good budget cpu
customer_reviews.text: Good price for okay cpu. Good budget cpu for playing older games paired with the right gpu
customer_reviews.author: Eaven B.

customer_reviews.title: great budget CPU but more expensive yet has the same ...
customer_reviews.text: great budget CPU but more expensive yet has the same performace as the G4560. not taking off more than one star as this is the G4560's fault for being so good. (took off one star to say that it is not well priced WHEN compare to the G4560)
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just a great CPU for when you need more clock speed.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob C

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent I have it for almost a year and it work like a dream, like brand new, I am glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: julia

customer_reviews.title: Loud
customer_reviews.text: It works well for a few months and then it gets to be really loud.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice budget CPU for simple computer use. Google, Youtbe, Office etc.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Polley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this i3. It was cheap and offers great performance on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: David McClung

customer_reviews.title: what a waste of
customer_reviews.text: its missing the cpu, only came with the fan. what a waste of time
customer_reviews.author: kerman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great, came with the cpu fan, I love it thank you
customer_reviews.author: Thomas I. Van Horn

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: set it up in no time at all. works great
customer_reviews.author: waihenya

customer_reviews.title: Getting elderly, but still good entry level processor...
customer_reviews.text: Decent & cheap solution for a budget build, which I did for a co-worker's girlfriend's kid, who simply wants to play some 5 year old on-line WWII game. He'll like it, plenty fast enough for that utilizing a B250M Gigabyte MOBO and 8Gb of RAM. I DID scrape off the wax sludge Intel puts on the fan contact plate and installed Arctic Silver...
customer_reviews.author: Dave B

customer_reviews.title: For basic computer use, this is an excellent CPU.
customer_reviews.text: If you're doing basic web surfing, word processing, emailing, and Turbo Taxing, this CPU is truly excellent. It's inexpensive, low power, low heat, and low fan noise. You would bump to the i5 or i7 if you are regularly doing tasks that benefit from more cores: compiling lots of computer program code, re-encoding [pirated] videos, etc. There are lots of special circumstances where an i5 or i7 is useful; if you're one of those special people you already know it. If not, then this 3.9 GHz i3 is a great CPU. (P.S.: at work I have a 12-core machine and compile a whole lot of computer code; at home, the i3 is my gem.)
customer_reviews.author: P. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Strong performer that has proven itself while powering highly-utilized virtual machinery.
customer_reviews.text: This Intel Core i3, 7th generation microprocessor, of the 7100 series is better than whatever was running my old, reliable Tandy 1000. It is now powering a ESXi server with a virtual machine Debian-based Network Attached Storage and a Server Core domain controller. On the NAS VM, I have multiple Docker containers and a ZFS pool. On the DC VM, I have DNS, DHCP, and AD DS (naturally). Anyways, it works very well and I consider it an excellent bang for the buck if you can forgo some of the niceties of Xenon, such as ECC support.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Would have gotten something better if I had more money but it's still good ...
customer_reviews.text: It's okay for the price. Would have gotten something better if I had more money but it's still good enough for gaming (with good gpu, intigrated is okey on low to med settings on most modern games) and many work loads along with with some virtualization tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Not bad if you are on a budget or need a cheap upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: A little pricier than a Celeron for my second mining rig, I am glad I spent a couple extra bucks for this CPU. It's got plenty of juice to service 6 RX580s and I can still mine 2 of the cores and get snappy system response under Windows 10 Pro.
customer_reviews.author: joemaamah

customer_reviews.title: Extreme cooling ;)
customer_reviews.text: This thing is massive. I used it on an in win case that had a Max CPU cooler support of 158mm. This is about 160mm and fit perfect. Installed on an i3 7100 and dropped nearly 20°c. From 41°c to 27°c....... This ultimate comes with the better fan, the universal version has a slimmer fan
customer_reviews.author: MysticGohan 198814

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend looking for an upgrade as it bottlenecks my 1060 ...
customer_reviews.text: For your money, you get what you get, although for gaming, I would recommend looking for an upgrade as it bottlenecks my 1060 ssc 6gb by ~15%.
customer_reviews.author: Josue Giron

customer_reviews.title: On a budget?
customer_reviews.text: Built my sister a computer, this is a great budget CPU paired with a 1050Ti or 1060 3GB Varient Gaming in high to medium setting at 1080p is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Mustafa Mehmedovic

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: quick shipping - love intel - they did a great job
customer_reviews.author: Grant Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Good CPU, not the best cooler.
customer_reviews.text: The CPU is great with zero issues. The stock heatsink is a PITA to get locked down. Took several tries to carefully put enough pressure (to the point of bending the motherboard some) until the cooler's 4 bolts were secure.
customer_reviews.author: RuA

customer_reviews.title: A budget gaming pc must-have!
customer_reviews.text: An amazing processor for the price! This guy has never failed me yet! Oddly enough, this processor actually has a powerful integrated graphics that it can run gta v quite playable. If you pair this with a gtx 1050 ti, you got yourself a nice budget build!
customer_reviews.author: John Alexander The Great

customer_reviews.title: Nice CPU for the price!
customer_reviews.text: It worked as expected. Not a single problem. While looking for the thermal past, I didn't realize Intel actually delivers the cooler with the past on it, so be careful. Cooler is very quiet, I can barely ear it running! I have to look at the case on light to see if the computer is on. Counter Strike GO runs fine, along with other games. I recommend it if you are building a budget system.
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo F

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should, but not the best value.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it should, price should be cheaper considering it performance.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie E.

customer_reviews.title: Definitly worth if your short on cash but functions like a charm
customer_reviews.text: The intel Core i3 is definitely a good choice if your on a strict budget in my case I built a custom computer for a cousin of mine from scratch and the computer runs FalloutNV 60 Fps & Counter strike. I noticed the fan included already had thermal paste already on it so the assembly was a piece of cake.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel.M

customer_reviews.title: Great budget processor
customer_reviews.text: Got this when i built my first pc with a 1060 6gb. I’ve played many games like pubg, overwatch, gta v, etc all on high settings no problem!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU for non gaming task.
customer_reviews.text: Great CPU. I am using it for a 6 1080Ti mining rig and it is performing 24/7 at 30%/40% utilization perfectly. Intel makes some quality products. The CPU runs at 38-52 degrees celsius for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota Bradford

customer_reviews.title: It's a good processor ok for gaming
customer_reviews.text: It's a good processor ok for gaming. Runs most games with a 1050 TI OC well. Good Product! Go to a I5 if your going to use a bigger video card it will bottleneck leaving the I3 to pull the weight and leave you with a blue screen.
customer_reviews.author: high heel girl

customer_reviews.title: Better single thread performance than an i5, and a great value
customer_reviews.text: Better single thread performance than an i5, and a great value
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Fast and cheap - a great combo
customer_reviews.text: I just built my first computer for my freelance writing and photography business. This is the processor I chose since I don't do a lot of gaming or video. It performs really well. I'm about one month into use.
customer_reviews.author: Buying_the_Internet

customer_reviews.title: 7th Gen Budget Speed Advantage!
customer_reviews.text: This chip is very fast for the price. Pretty much stands with the AMD 8350 CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Chase from San Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad CPU for PFsense since it support AES-NI. Plus it only draws 53 Watts
customer_reviews.author: Thomas D.

customer_reviews.title: works fine
customer_reviews.text: works fine for the build I use it for it's perfect fan noise is too loud
customer_reviews.author: Ali Megdad

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my mini itx mobile gaming PC. Low power and low heat.
customer_reviews.author: D00dleB0b

customer_reviews.title: this CPU has a better single-core speed than my older i5 and i7 CPUs
customer_reviews.text: While low on cores, this CPU has a better single-core speed than my older i5 and i7 CPUs. I'm even using it to power my Oculus Rift.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy C Tran

customer_reviews.title: A budget Duo Core i5 in Disguise
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this processor for it's price range. I recently custom built two PC's each with a different task in mind. I used this processor on both and both run flawlessly. One is a Minecraft machine which is very CPU intensive and this i3 matches the performance of my i5 in my laptop. The other machine is built for more graphic gaming and the cpu rarely ramps up to full load under heavy gaming. This is due to the fact that I used a budget gtx 1050 which became my bottleneck but the i3 did have plenty of room to grow.
customer_reviews.author: Budget Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great performance and low cost
customer_reviews.text: This micro is really amazing, i m a casual gamer , and aI have GTX 1050 evga video card an 8 GB of ram ( ballistics 8GB DDR4 2400) and this budget works better than a PS4 or Xbox one, I play GTA V , far cry 4, BF1 and I am very happy with his performance. at first I hesitate between this and the ryzen 1200, but this i3 with 2 cores exceeds the ryzen in many ways
customer_reviews.author: NKLT

customer_reviews.title: lovely
customer_reviews.text: I have no gpu and only 8gbs of DDR4 and it runs dirty bomb on medium preset at like 60 fps some times dips into the low 40s and high 30s but idc
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt M.

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive & Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I needed a replacement CPU for a spare motherboard I had and this one was inexpensive and filled the bill. It fits and runs well in my H170 based ASUS motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Knuckle Busted

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: i3-7100, Samsung evo ssd, gtx1050, 8gb ddr4. This chip is a wolf in sheep's clothing. Forget about g4400 unless you're using it to boot a 110 mb for a bios update.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I first paired this with a 1050 2GB video card but later upgraded to a 1060 3GB card. I can play most current games at high/ultra settings. I see no need to go up to an i5 at this point.
customer_reviews.author: C. Demeter

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and good temps
customer_reviews.text: Solid processor for browsing the web and light workloads. Easy install and good temps.
customer_reviews.author: casey gillins

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: If you aren't a gamer then just get this for your desktop PC. Have built a few computers with this CPU and its been very good to me in terms of price and power usage.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin D. Uecker

customer_reviews.title: If you wish to remain on Windows 7 AVOID THIS ...
customer_reviews.text: If you wish to remain on Windows 7 AVOID THIS, or any 7th Gen Core. It's the newer generation of processors that Windows will require you to have Windows 10. This doesn't work for me since our thermal printer and software is not working in Windows 10 yet. I did not learn this until a few hours after installing Windows 7 and many patches, when finally a window pops up telling me to upgrade Windows.
customer_reviews.author: Justene Harden

customer_reviews.title: Ok for light tasks, not good for watching a video while doing a second thing.
customer_reviews.text: It's a hyperthreaded dual-core CPU, which in this day in my opinion isn't powerful enough. Full quad-core at least is needed for future-resisting and avoiding CPU bottlenecks in everyday tasks like browsing and video watching. For one task at a time, it works fine, but for multiple I needed more oomph. Watching a YouTube video while keeping a streaming tab off to the side pretty much maxed out the CPU resulting in stuttering.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: I installed it onto ASUS Prime H270 Pro a week ago. The first start up was a success, no issues so far. The box cooler is a bit noisy though, I would recommend replacing it.
customer_reviews.author: Aleksandr

customer_reviews.title: Great processor
customer_reviews.text: Great processor, make sure that the motherboard you're getting supports it. The mobo i bought had to have a bios update before it would post with this processor inside, i had to put my skylake i7 6700k just to update it, kinda crappy but that's what i get for not doing enough research beforehand. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: SmartShopper

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice processor. Did exactly what I expected it to.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Screams for a dual core
customer_reviews.text: It has hyper threading so it has as many threads as a quad core but just 2 physical cores great for my mom's pc she just plays world of warcraft
customer_reviews.author: Jason Denwalt

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for the average computer
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is great, powers my 4k monitor for videos fine and runs the basics smoothly. I had a 7700k but decided to wait for the next generation and hope that it uses the same socket. For everyday tasks, web browsing, office, music, videos it runs smoothly and efficiently. For those tasks I could not see a difference at all between the two. I have not attempted any games with this and I use a different computer for video and photo editing so I cannot comment on that. If you are an average computer user and want to be using the latest generation of Intel products the I3-7100 will certainly do the job at a very low price.
customer_reviews.author: vc

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU for gaming, general use, or even a small home server like I am doing.
customer_reviews.text: 2 cores, 4 threads, very powerful with minimal power use and heat production. Using this for my home server running plex, recording security cam footage, etc. On 24/7 and barely breaks a sweat. Working out perfect as it uses about 8watts most of the time for the CPU, just my hard drives that are soaking up all the power.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic processor for light gaming and desktop usage.
customer_reviews.text: Super nice processor. Comes with a heat sink fan and thermal grease. I used the fan and it worked great with the processor. For my needs this processor was more than enough.
customer_reviews.author: Zoinks!

customer_reviews.title: Decent for gaming with moderately priced graphics card
customer_reviews.text: Good for a budget gaming PC, cores decently clocked and experiencing no bottlenecks with 1050ti Don't expect to be using this to do any sort of heavy number crunching but for what it is, it does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: internetquickie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It runs very well. loving the 7th generations keep it up Intel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for most users
customer_reviews.text: Good enough for most users. If you need something stronger you will know. Also also just a PSA it does not work with windows 7.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Best i3 yet
customer_reviews.text: New skylake is epic preforms just as fast as older quad core i5 CPU's Got a cinabench R15 score of 419 on Windows 10 pro 64bit
customer_reviews.author: Daniel D'Alessio

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Very good for a casual workstation, does most tasks without hiccup. Heat is fine under normal load with the stock cooler
customer_reviews.author: Brett-Michael Green

customer_reviews.title: Best i3.... Ever?
customer_reviews.text: Super fast! Used for a build for a receptionist, and paired with a samsung 850 evo, this system flies! Customer said one of the fastest computers shes ever used. Its that core per core @4.0 ghz! Really impressed me. Good one intel!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Ertmer

customer_reviews.title: Supports faster ram!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried that this 7th generation processor would not work on my board but I did a little research and with a bios update my skylake Gigabyte motherboard worked. this chip is fast and Benchmarked in the 6000 points. My Ram is running at 2400 now compared to my Skylake i5 processor I had before. I love it I just kind of wish I should have save my money for the i5 7th generation
customer_reviews.author: Barrioscriptures

customer_reviews.title: Careful if you want this for gaming!
customer_reviews.text: i used this processor in a budget under $700 build with a 1060 3GB card. Well it works for sure and I saw 60 frames in dark souls 3 across the board no issues on high settings. However, the amount of stuttering is horrendous! Dark souls 3 isn't CPU intensive and I even turned settings down to help it but saw no improvement. I highly recommend going for nothing less than an i5.. which I'm now purchasing an i5-7500 to suit my needs. Honestly I would only buy this for "LIGHT" gaming only. Otherwise good luck with stutters and getting frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: ASTAM

customer_reviews.title: would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Works great very fast. Use it for office work. Paired it with an msi pro it's motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: EA

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming CPU
customer_reviews.text: Great processor for gaming, however it is only about 10-15% faster that a pentium g4560 for twice the price. Hower this cpu is best if you want a well rounded pc using about 8gb of ddr4 and a rx480 or gtx1060 with no bottlenecking. The pentium is a great cpu but may have a slight bottleneck on the cards listed above. So if the 60$ is not a big deal to you this cpu will give you a peace of mind of a well rounded budget machine. Also worth noting a benefit of kaby lake is its required for 4k streaming netflix on pc's so this is a good feature.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: CPU was DOA
customer_reviews.text: CPU was DOA. Never had a problem with Intel before. Tried everything: Ran the motherboard with only CPU and RAM, used different know working RAM, tried different motherboard, etc. Finally, tried a known working CPU and the problem was solved. I am sure there are a few bad chips every 1 in 100, so do not let this review steer you away completely. Just don't be that unlucky 1%.
customer_reviews.author: BillKilla

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping and exactly what I was needing for my budget build.
customer_reviews.author: michael lanham

customer_reviews.title: Great budget friendly CPU
customer_reviews.text: Needed to build an updated budget machine to replace an 8 year old desktop. Paired with an MSI H110M Grenade motherboard, 8GB DDR4, and M.2 SSD. New machine is a huge upgrade in performance over the old Core 2 Duo machine it replaced. I did have to use a 6th Gen CPU to do a BIOS update prior to installed my 7th gen cpu. I was able to borrow one from a friend. The machine is plenty fast for some light gaming and all of the typical desktop applications.
customer_reviews.author: brc1981

customer_reviews.title: WARNING! Does not work with Windows 7
customer_reviews.text: I use windows 10, I have no issues with it. However I bought this for a friend to upgrade an old desktop. He likes windows 7. This CPU does not work with Windows 7, because of a marketing/sales decision by Microsoft. This is fine, however the product description should say in big bold letters: THIS IS THE FIRST INTEL x86/x64 CPU THAT DOES NOT SUPPORT WINDOWS 7. So my issues is with the product listing on Amazon. The CPU itself is great.
customer_reviews.author: peter s.

customer_reviews.title: Works Good
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Make sure the motherboard you buy has a 200 series chipset.
customer_reviews.author: Matt I

customer_reviews.title: Dual core just doesn't cut it anymore.
customer_reviews.text: All that power seems to be wasted on dual cores. My 6 year old laptop octa core can handle things better. Too bad I can't transfer it over.
customer_reviews.author: Yanuel Morales

customer_reviews.title: COMPATIBLE MOTHERBOARD
customer_reviews.text: PAY ATTENTION TO YOUR MOTHERBOARD BEFORE THIS. Make sure your motherboard has the latest update when get the intel kaby lake. I was dumb because I purchased the Gigabyte H110-A and the computer wouldn't work for some reason. I was sure it was the same socket LGA 1151 but for some reason the computer kept turning on and off. After accepting defeat I took it to a computer shop (yes i know what an amateur). They realized that it wasnt working because the motherboard wasn't updated to intel kaby lake. So in conclusion, MAKE SURE YOUR MOTHERBOARD IS UPDATED BEFORE YOU BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Christian Emperador
